content:
Gift-shock from awakened wild Mage-Gift; magical channels burned open, causing white-hot agony and blurred vision; Chosen by Senta—bonded; carries red robe hood as evidence

Unconscious 4 days; channels stabilized by herbs but fragile; memories of attack psychologically blocked. Commitment: ordered Senta to knock him out if he loses control near leadership. Status: arrived Haven as new Herald-Chosen; deemed dangerous wild talent by Healers.

STATUS: Herald-trainee officially; quartered at Healer's cottage in Companion's Field for safety. COMMITMENT: Maintaining discretion about Mage-Gift. GIFT: Confirmed Mage-Gift—energy blast leveled Lisle; first manifestation in generations since Vanyel; no living teachers available.

IDENTITY: Unpartnered Companion mare for 3 years; silver hooves, sapphire eyes, silver-white mane. ARC: Chose Rance—bond formed; stabilizing his wild Gift through connection; determined to get him to Haven alive despite his recklessness. STANCE-Rance: unconditional love through Choice bond; frustrated by his stubbornness and self-destructive behavior; protective; shares purpose to reach Haven and train his Gift

Suspicion confirmed: Gift likely rarer/more dangerous than Firestarting; unprecedented in 5 centuries; no one capable of training him. Assessment: Rance thinks like Herald already; shows military-level tactical analysis beyond village headman norm. Journey: maintained tireless 4-day pace to Haven without real rest; exhausted on arrival but refused to leave Chosen's side. Met Rolan (Queen's Own Companion) on arrival.

REALIZATION: Rance has raw wild Mage-Gift—kind not seen since Vanyel's time; understands he rewrote magical theory within days of Choosing. STANCE-Rance: Protective during Circle meeting; proud of his practical leadership; concerned about political tightrope; dry humor about expecting complications but not this scale; steady anchor through extraordinary events; accepts their life won't be dull Circuit routes.

Fully recovered after grooming and rest; coat gleaming, energy restored.

STANCE-Rance: concerned about untrained Mage-Gift use (door slam, potential fire lighting); maintains physical distance during intimate moments but cannot fully shield through bond; pragmatic about time constraints. STANCE-Talia: protective; understands she needed vulnerability/surrender after years of isolation.

Village obliterated—reduced to ash, charred timber, scorched foundations; small crater at epicenter; destroyed by Rance's uncontrolled Gift awakening during bandit attack; residents carried off before destruction; located near borders of Karse, Rethwellan, Menmellith

Bond snaps into place like key in lock; unconditional love floods Chosen's mind; mind-speech established; knowledge flows about Gift nature; Companion presence soothes damaged mental channels; creates bridges across burning chasms in mind; forms 'other half of soul' connection

Occurs when latent Gift forcibly awakens; mental channels burned open by raw power; causes white-hot agony, blurred vision, teetering sanity, difficulty focusing; requires herbs and rest at Waystation; can cause permanent mind fracture if untreated; Companion bond helps stabilize

Organized group disguised as bandits; wore red robes hidden under bandit clothing; attacked Lisle to incapacitate and carry off residents; fled to or toward Menmellith after Rance's Gift awakened; may return to confirm results; possibly cult or sect

Historical practice: ritual sacrifice, demon summoning via captured prisoners—Valdemaran stories dismissed as myth hold truth. Officially banned in Karse for decades. Lisle attack evidence: red-robed figures (Karsite features despite Menmellith misdirection), organized prisoner-taking instead of killing (requires effort/risk), suggests possible revival of blood magic practices. Border implications: Lisle near three-nation border; enough interaction for Rance to recognize Karsite features.

Sun-Priests suspected of returning to human sacrifice and blood magic—possibly demon summoning; shows cyclical returns during internal instability; live captives needed for fresh sacrifice (more power); special forces with military-grade weapons took villagers alive including young and elderly; represents fundamental policy shift if confirmed; attacking across Valdemar border—unknown if other nations targeted.

Rance believed Herald-Mages were historical fiction/idealized myth. Reality: Vanyel Ashkevron's last stand, Valdemaran border construction, Karse war—all actual history. Herald-Mage Savil's teaching referenced: 'Power is neither good nor evil, only its application.'

Herald-basics transfer naturally through bond—Chosen gain knowledge of Empaths, Mind-Healers, protocol without prior training. Bond strengthens with time/distance; thoughts and emotions become clearer to both parties. Connection makes two beings 'something greater than sum of parts.'

Capital city reached after 4-day journey from Lisle region. Features: white stone walls, Palace complex at heart, Collegium for Herald training within grounds, Healers' Collegium. Guards recognize Companion emergencies; messengers alert appropriate personnel. Queen's Own Companion Rolan present. Protocol: wild talents see specialized Healers before Circle exposure due to danger.

STATE: Recovering from complete mind-merge with Rance under Healer Crescent's care; profoundly overwhelmed but unharmed; worked through buried trauma during merge—decades of self-doubt, fear of Empathy consuming identity, isolation from carrying kingdom's burdens alone; left in better emotional state than before despite overwhelm. SHARED: Rance now possesses her complete life—escape from Sensholding, Rolan's Choosing, Empathy awakening, every state secret, all training, wine preferences (47 vintage), every private moment. STANCE-Rance: Intimate knowledge shared both ways; he saw her deepest vulnerabilities; complicated mix of violation/gratitude/fascination; their passionate kiss closed the connection; uncertain how relationship will proceed.

Made definitive decision about handling shared memory situation; speaks with formal Court precision. Physical disorientation continues—reaches for his memories that are now fragments; stride length mismatch when walking.

STATE: virginity taken by Rance; bite mark on breast; physically marked. ARC: crossed threshold from untouched to claimed; discovered arousal from submission/degradation; surrendered control for first time in adult life; broke years of self-denial. STANCE-Rance: sexually claimed; responds intensely to dominance and crude language; begged to be degraded during sex; decided to recommend formalizing connection to Selenay as co-advisors (semi-official—Circle knows, public doesn't); shields waver around him but he can shore them up; terrified of losing herself but trusts him to prevent it.

REACTION: Initial composure cracked at confirmation of Mage-Gift and complete mind-merge; Rance casually demonstrated Talia's intimate knowledge (wine preferences) proving claim; processing that untrained man now possesses all kingdom's sensitive information; approved Healer's cottage quarantine; ordered information sealed to Circle only; grateful for warning about Karse. CONCERN: Security vulnerability of two people with Queen's Own knowledge; political implications; whether Talia recovers full capabilities.

STANCE-Rance: Stood beside him throughout Circle meeting without Talia present—deliberate endorsement; silent legitimization of extraordinary claims; assessed situation with grave concern tempered by hope; presence reassured skeptical Circle members; his approval carries weight beyond words.

ASSESSMENT: Confirmed Karsite special forces—recent issue, official sanction not rogues; prisoners taken alive suggests purposeful action. STANCE-Rance: Tested then respected after Rance proved not extremist Vkandis worshipper; pragmatic focus on training, containment, protection needs; noted security concerns of two with Queen's Own knowledge.
IDENTITY: Lord Marshal's Herald; military bearing. TASKED: Making discreet inquiries to Rethwellan, Hardorn, Menmellith about Karsite activity on their borders.
IDENTITY: Chronicler; severe-looking; knowledgeable about cyclical Karsite extremism. TASKED: Searching archives for sealed records from Vanyel's time regarding Mage-Gift training.

ASSESSMENT: Complete mind-merge should have killed them both or driven them insane; shocked Rance casually dismissed catastrophic event; reluctantly cleared both as physically stable despite impossibility. TASKED: Caring for Talia; observing both afterward.

KNOWLEDGE: Sealed information—Rance has Mage-Gift (first since Vanyel); complete mind-merge with Talia giving him all state secrets; Karsite blood magic suspected; live captives taken from Lisle. DECISION: Information contained to Circle only; Rance officially just Herald-trainee; quartered at Healer's cottage; investigations into Karsite activity across all borders; will debate political ramifications privately.

Rance confirmed as Herald-Mage; raw wild power capable of leveling villages when untrained; true Mage-Gift allows reshaping reality itself; archives may contain sealed training records from Vanyel's era; return coinciding with Karsite blood magic noted as unlikely to be coincidental.

Complete memory-merge between Rance and Talia—full bidirectional sharing of entire lives; functionally impossible without decades of training; should have killed both or driven them insane; unprecedented in all Valdemaran records; Rance used untrained Mage-Gift to stabilize Talia and guide separation; closed connection with passionate kiss; creates security vulnerability—two people now possess Queen's Own's complete knowledge.

Old cottage in Companion's Field; chosen as Rance's quarters; remote enough to not level Collegium during magical incidents; close enough to not be isolated; allows discreet meetings; official reason for separate housing unspecified—rumor mill will generate competing theories naturally.
Rance reported Lisle attack to Circle; Karsite blood magic suspected
